entry.title: A Note on Public Communication
entry.summary: There are a series of emails that have been exchanged on the Lightning-dev mailing list. One email contains a message from /devfd0, who is against frivolous legal claims and believes in respecting freedom of expression, presumption of innocence, and due process in the Bitcoin common space. Another email from Tony Giorgio questions if there is a better place for public communication as the mailing list has become a ghost town. Meanwhile, niftynei emphasizes the importance of holding conversations in public to document the range of options considered for technical decisions and provide an interface point for new participants to contribute to the discussion. Aymeric Vitte, who sent one of the emails, provides links to his CV, LinkedIn profile, GitHub account, and various Bitcoin-related projects he has worked on. The context suggests that the Lightning community should focus on technical topics and avoid getting involved in personal conflicts that can damage the community's ability to discuss and exchange ideas.
